briefTitle: Alcohol Research Consortium in HIV-Intervention Research Arm
officialTitle: Alcohol Research Consortium in HIV-Intervention Research Arm

primary.description: Difference in Audit-C score, pre and post intervention. The AUDIT-C is scored on a scale of 0-12 (scores of 0 reflect no alcohol use). In men, a score of 4 or more is considered positive; in women, a score of 3 or more is considered positive. Generally, the higher the AUDIT-C score, the more likely it is that the patient's drinking is affecting his/her health and safety.

secondary.description: PEth is a biomarker for recent alcohol use found in the blood that is specific to ethanol ingestion and can detect low-to heavy drinking levels.
